faqs.question: How do I log into the admin panel?
faqs.answer: To access the admin panel, navigate to the login page and enter your admin credentials (email and password). Only authorized administrators can access the system. If you don't have credentials, contact your super administrator.
steps: Navigate to /login page or the root URL
Enter your registered email address in the Email field
Enter your password in the Password field
Click the 'Sign In' button
You'll be redirected to the Dashboard upon successful login
troubleshooting: If login fails, verify your email and password are correct
Ensure your account is enabled and verified
Contact your super administrator if issues persist

faqs.question: What should I do when I first log in?
faqs.answer: After your first login, familiarize yourself with the interface and set up your initial content.
steps: Explore the Dashboard to understand system metrics
Navigate through each section using the top navigation bar
Check the floating chatbot in the bottom-right corner
Review any pending questions in the Queries section
Add your first content via the Upload section
tips: Start with the Dashboard to get an overview
Test the chatbot functionality early
Upload sample content to see how the system works

faqs.question: What do all the dashboard metrics mean?
faqs.answer: The Dashboard displays key performance indicators and system statistics to help you monitor your chatbot's performance.

metrics: Answered Questions - Total successfully resolved user queries
Pending Questions - Questions awaiting admin response
Average Response Time - System performance metric in seconds
Total Files in Database - Number of uploaded documents
Total Uploaded Texts - Direct text knowledge entries
Active Users - Current users interacting with the system

actions: Click on metric cards to navigate to relevant sections
Use 'View All' buttons to see detailed data
Monitor trends using the visual charts

faqs.question: How do I interpret the Request Count Graph?
faqs.answer: The Request Count Graph shows system usage patterns over time, helping you understand peak usage periods and system load.
steps: View the graph in the lower section of the Dashboard
Use the time interval dropdown to change the view (1min, 5min, 10min, etc.)
Adjust data points slider to show more or fewer data points
Toggle auto-refresh to keep data current
Hover over data points to see exact values
features: Customizable time intervals from 1 minute to 1 hour

faqs.question: What are the Quick Actions on the Dashboard?
faqs.answer: Quick Actions provide immediate access to common administrative tasks without navigating through menus.
actions: Upload Files - Direct access to file upload functionality
Add Text Content - Quick text knowledge entry
Test Chatbot - Open the floating chatbot for testing
View Questions - Navigate to the Questions overview
tips: Use Quick Actions for frequent tasks
Test new content immediately after uploading
Monitor system status indicators regularly

faqs.question: How do I refresh dashboard data?
faqs.answer: The Dashboard supports both manual and automatic data refresh to keep information current.
steps: Use the 'Refresh' button in the top-right corner for manual refresh
Enable auto-refresh toggle for automatic updates every minute
Individual sections refresh when you navigate back to the Dashboard
Charts update in real-time when auto-refresh is enabled

faqs.question: How do I navigate between different sections?
faqs.answer: The main navigation is located in the top navigation bar. Each section has a dedicated page with specific functionality.
sections: Dashboard - System overview, metrics, and quick actions
Upload - File and text content management with filtering
Queries - Handle pending and answered questions from users
Questions - Browse all user and admin questions with advanced filtering
Departments - Manage department settings, keywords, and routing
Help & FAQs - Complete documentation and user manual
Admin - Super admin only database and user management
features: Role-based menu items (Admin section for super admins only)

faqs.question: How do I access user settings and logout?
faqs.answer: Click on your avatar in the top-right corner to access user options including profile information and logout functionality.
steps: Look for your avatar/initial circle in the top-right corner of the navigation
Click on the avatar to open the dropdown menu
Select 'Profile' to view your account information and role
Select 'Logout' to safely sign out of the system
Confirm logout in the dialog that appears to complete the process

faqs.question: How do I use the floating chatbot widget?
faqs.answer: The floating chatbot widget allows you to test the chatbot functionality in real-time from any page.
steps: Look for the chat bubble icon in the bottom-right corner of any page
Click the icon to open the chatbot interface
Type your test question in the input field
Press Enter or click the Send button to submit
Review the chatbot's response for accuracy
Use the minimize button to close the widget
features: Integration with 'Test in Chat' buttons from other sections
tips: Test new content immediately after uploading
Use questions from the Questions section for testing
Verify department routing works correctly

faqs.question: How do I upload files to the knowledge base?
faqs.answer: Use the Upload page to add documents that will enhance your chatbot's knowledge base. The system supports multiple file formats and processes them automatically.
steps: Navigate to Upload page from the main navigation menu
Go to the 'File Upload' section at the top
Select the appropriate department from the dropdown menu
Click 'Select Files' button to open the file browser
Choose one or multiple files (supported: PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, MD)
Click 'Upload Files' button to start the upload process
Monitor the upload progress and wait for completion notification
tips: Files are automatically processed and vectorized after upload
Large files may take several minutes to process completely
Ensure files contain relevant information for the selected department
Check processing status in the Uploaded Files tab
limitations: Maximum file size limits may apply based on server configuration
Processing time increases with file size and complexity
Some corrupted or password-protected files may fail to process

faqs.question: How do I add text content directly?
faqs.answer: You can add text knowledge directly without uploading files, which is perfect for quick content addition, FAQs, or specific information entries.
steps: Navigate to Upload page from the main menu
Scroll down to the 'Text Content' section
Select the appropriate department from the dropdown
Enter a clear, descriptive title in the Title field
Add your complete text content in the large text area
Review your content for accuracy and completeness
Click 'Add Text Content' button to save to the knowledge base
best_practices: Use descriptive titles that reflect the content's purpose
Write clear, comprehensive text that answers common questions
Include relevant keywords that users might search for
Structure content with proper formatting when possible
examples: FAQ entries with questions and detailed answers

faqs.question: How do I manage uploaded files?
faqs.answer: The Uploaded Files tab provides comprehensive tools to view, manage, and organize all your uploaded documents.
steps: Navigate to Upload page and click 'Uploaded Files' tab
Use the filter dropdown to show 'All Content' or 'My Content'
Apply department filter to narrow down results
Use the search bar to find specific files by name
Click on any file row to view detailed information
Use action buttons for preview, download, or delete operations
features: File information display (name, size, type, upload date)
filters: All Content - Shows all files from all admins
My Content - Shows only files you uploaded
Department filter - Filter by specific departments
Search by filename - Find files by name or partial name

faqs.question: How do I manage text knowledge entries?
faqs.answer: The Text Knowledge tab allows you to view, edit, and manage all directly entered text content in the system.
steps: Navigate to Upload page and click 'Text Knowledge' tab
Use filters to show 'All Content' or 'My Content'
Apply department and search filters as needed
Click on any text entry to view full content
Use 'Edit' button to modify existing text content
Use 'Delete' button to remove unwanted entries
editing_process: Click the 'Edit' button on any text knowledge entry
Modify the title and/or content in the popup dialog
Click 'Save Changes' to update the entry
Changes are immediately available to the chatbot
Use 'Cancel' to discard changes without saving
features: Chunk count display for large content

faqs.question: How do I use the advanced filtering and search features?
faqs.answer: The Upload page includes powerful filtering and search capabilities to help you find and manage content efficiently.
filtering_options: Content Ownership - Filter by 'All Content' or 'My Content'
Department Filter - Show content from specific departments only
File Type Filter - Available in file management for different formats
Processing Status - Filter by upload/processing status
search_capabilities: Filename Search - Find files by name or partial name matching
Content Search - Search within text knowledge titles and content
Real-time filtering - Results update as you type
Case-insensitive matching - Searches ignore letter case
tips: Combine filters for more precise results
Use 'My Content' filter to quickly find your uploads
Search works across all visible content based on current filters
Clear filters to see all available content

faqs.question: What should I do if uploads fail or have errors?
faqs.answer: Upload failures can occur due to various reasons. Here's how to troubleshoot and resolve common issues.
common_issues: File too large - Check file size limits with your administrator
Unsupported format - Ensure file is in supported format (PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, MD)
Network timeout - Try uploading smaller files or check internet connection
Processing failure - File may be corrupted or have formatting issues
troubleshooting_steps: Check the file format and size before uploading
Try uploading files one at a time instead of multiple files
Ensure stable internet connection during upload
Wait for current uploads to complete before starting new ones
prevention_tips: Use standard file formats and avoid corrupted files
Keep file sizes reasonable for faster processing
Ensure files contain readable text content
Test with smaller files first if having issues

faqs.question: What is the Queries page and how do I use it?
faqs.answer: The Queries page is the central hub for managing questions that need admin attention. It has two main tabs for pending and answered questions.
sections: Pending Questions Tab - Questions awaiting admin responses
Answered Questions Tab - Previously resolved questions
Filter Panel - Filter by department, admin, or sorting options
Question Cards - Individual question displays with actions

faqs.question: How do I handle pending queries from users?
faqs.answer: Pending queries are questions that the chatbot couldn't answer automatically and require admin intervention.
steps: Navigate to Queries page from the main navigation
Ensure you're on the 'Pending Questions' tab
Review the list of unanswered questions with priority indicators
Click the 'Answer' button on any question you want to respond to
Read the question carefully and any acceptance criteria provided
Type your comprehensive answer in the text area provided
Use 'Test in Chat' button to verify your answer works correctly
Click 'Submit Answer' to save your response and mark as resolved
tips: Questions with higher frequency get priority highlighting
Include step-by-step instructions when applicable
Use clear, concise language that users can understand
Test your answers before submitting to ensure accuracy
Consider adding related information for comprehensive responses

faqs.question: How do I review and manage answered queries?
faqs.answer: The Answered Questions tab shows all previously resolved queries, allowing you to review, test, and verify responses.
steps: Navigate to Queries page
Click on the 'Answered Questions' tab
Browse through the list of resolved questions
Use filters to find specific departments, admins, or timeframes
Click on any question card to view the full question and answer
Use 'Test in Chat' to verify the answer still works correctly
Monitor for any questions that might need answer updates
tips: Regularly review answered questions for accuracy
Update answers when policies or procedures change
Use testing to ensure answers remain relevant
Monitor user feedback on answered questions

faqs.question: How do I use the filtering and sorting options in Queries?
faqs.answer: The Queries page includes comprehensive filtering and sorting tools to help you manage questions efficiently.
filtering_options: Department Filter - Show questions from specific departments
Admin Filter - Filter by admin who asked or answered questions
Sort By - Order by date, priority, or department
Sort Order - Ascending or descending order
steps: Use the filter panel at the top of the Queries page
Select department from the dropdown to filter by department
Choose admin filter to see questions from specific admins
Use sort options to organize questions by date, priority, or department
Toggle sort order between ascending and descending
Filters apply automatically as you make selections
tips: Combine multiple filters for precise results
Use date sorting to see newest or oldest questions first
Priority sorting helps identify urgent questions
Department filtering helps specialized admin focus areas

faqs.question: What is the Questions page and how is it different from Queries?
faqs.answer: The Questions page provides a comprehensive view of ALL questions in the system - both user and admin questions - with advanced analytics and filtering capabilities.
differences: Questions Page - Historical analysis and browsing of all questions
Queries focuses on workflow and response management
Questions focuses on data analysis and content overview
features: User Questions and Admin Questions tabs

faqs.question: How do I browse and analyze user questions?
faqs.answer: The User Questions tab shows all questions submitted by end users through the chatbot interface.
steps: Navigate to Questions page from main menu
Ensure you're on the 'User Questions' tab
Use filters to narrow down by department, status, or admin
Apply sorting by date, priority, or department
Use pagination to browse through multiple pages of questions
Click on any question to view detailed information in a popup
Use 'Test in Chat' to test the question with current system
filtering_options: Status - Filter by pending, processed, or all statuses
Admin - Filter by admin who handled questions
Sort by date, priority, or department

faqs.question: How do I manage admin questions?
faqs.answer: The Admin Questions tab shows questions submitted by administrators, typically for internal clarification or system testing.
steps: Navigate to Questions page
Click on the 'Admin Questions' tab
Use the same filtering and sorting options as user questions
View questions submitted by fellow administrators
Click on questions to see full details and responses
Use for training and knowledge sharing purposes

faqs.question: How do I use the AI question summarization feature?
faqs.answer: The Questions page includes an AI-powered summarization feature that analyzes pending user questions and provides insights.
steps: Navigate to Questions page and go to User Questions tab
Click the 'Summarize Pending Questions' button in the top right
Wait for the AI to analyze all pending questions
Review the generated summary in the popup dialog
Examine question categories and common themes
Use insights to improve your knowledge base and responses
tips: Run summaries regularly to identify patterns
Use category insights to improve department routing
Add common question themes to your knowledge base
Share summaries with team for collaborative improvement

faqs.question: How do I view detailed information for individual questions?
faqs.answer: Click on any question to open a detailed popup with comprehensive information about the question and its handling.
actions_available: Test in Chat - Test the question with current chatbot

faqs.question: How do I manage department keywords for routing?
faqs.answer: Keywords help the system route questions to the correct department automatically. You can add, edit, and remove keywords for each department.
steps: Navigate to Departments page
Go to 'Metadata Management' tab
Select the department you want to manage
Add new keywords in the input field (comma-separated)
Click 'Add Keywords' to save
Edit existing keywords by clicking the edit icon
Delete keywords using the trash icon
Keywords are automatically saved and active immediately
tips: Use relevant terms that users might mention
Include synonyms and common variations
Avoid overly generic keywords that might cause conflicts

faqs.question: How do I manage department descriptions?
faqs.answer: Department descriptions help provide context about what each department handles and can improve routing accuracy.
steps: Navigate to Departments page
Go to 'Metadata Management' tab
Scroll to 'Descriptions Management' section
Select the department from the dropdown
Enter or edit the department description
Click 'Update Description' to save changes
The description will be used by the system for better routing

faqs.question: How do I test department detection?
faqs.answer: Use the Detection Testing feature to verify that questions are being routed to the correct departments.
steps: Navigate to Departments page
Go to 'Detection Testing' tab
Enter a sample question in the text area
Click 'Test Detection' to analyze the question
Review the results showing detected department and confidence
If results are incorrect, adjust keywords or descriptions
Re-test to verify improvements

faqs.question: How do I handle department routing failures?
faqs.answer: The system tracks questions that couldn't be properly routed to departments, allowing you to improve the routing logic.
steps: Navigate to Departments page
Go to 'Department Failures' tab
Review questions that failed to route correctly
Analyze the failure reasons and patterns
Update keywords or descriptions based on failures
Process or discard failed routing attempts
Use 'Refresh Router Data' to update the system

faqs.question: How do I access the Super Admin panel?
faqs.answer: The Admin panel is only available to users with Super Admin role. It provides access to advanced system management features.
steps: Ensure you have Super Admin role assigned
Navigate to Admin page from the main menu
If you don't see the Admin option, you don't have sufficient permissions
Contact your system administrator to request Super Admin access
restrictions: Only Super Admins can access this section
Regular admins will see an 'Access Denied' message
Super Admin privileges are required for database operations

faqs.question: How do I manage admin users?
faqs.answer: Super Admins can create, edit, and manage other administrator accounts in the system.
steps: Navigate to Admin page
Go to 'Admin Management' tab
Click 'Add Admin' to create new administrator
Fill in name, email, password, and role information
Enable/disable admin accounts as needed
Edit existing admins by clicking the edit icon
Reset passwords using the key icon
Delete admins using the trash icon (with confirmation)
roles: admin - Regular administrator with standard access
super_admin - Full system access including user management

faqs.question: How do I perform database operations?
faqs.answer: Super Admins can perform various database operations including data deletion and system maintenance. These operations are irreversible and should be used with extreme caution.
steps: Navigate to Admin page
Go to 'Database Management' tab
Review current database statistics
Choose the appropriate deletion operation
Type the exact confirmation text when prompted
Confirm the operation (this cannot be undone)
Wait for the operation to complete
operations: Delete All Files - Removes all uploaded files and vectors
Delete All Text Knowledge - Removes all text content
Delete All User Questions - Removes all user queries
Delete All Admin Questions - Removes all admin questions
Delete All Department Failures - Clears routing failures
Delete All Response Times - Clears performance data
Delete Entire Vector Database - Complete database reset
warnings: Always backup important data before operations
System may be temporarily unavailable during operations

faqs.question: How do I test the chatbot functionality?
faqs.answer: Use the floating chatbot widget available on all pages to test questions and responses in real-time.
steps: Look for the chat bubble icon in the bottom-right corner
Click the icon to open the chatbot interface
Type your test question in the input field
Press Enter or click Send to submit
Review the chatbot's response
Use 'Test in Chat' buttons from Questions/Queries pages to automatically populate test questions

faqs.question: How do I test specific questions from the admin interface?
faqs.answer: Many sections include 'Test in Chat' buttons that automatically populate the chatbot with specific questions for testing.
steps: Navigate to Questions or Queries page
Find the question you want to test
Click the 'Test in Chat' button next to the question
The floating chatbot will open with the question pre-filled
Submit the question to see the current response
Compare with expected answers or make improvements as needed

faqs.question: What should I do if I can't log in?
faqs.answer: Login issues can occur due to various reasons. Follow these troubleshooting steps to resolve access problems.
steps: Verify your email address is correct
Check that your password is entered correctly
Ensure your account is enabled and verified
Clear browser cache and cookies
Try using a different browser or incognito mode
Contact your Super Administrator if issues persist

faqs.question: What should I do if the system is running slowly?
faqs.answer: Performance issues can affect your experience. Here are steps to improve system responsiveness.
steps: Check your internet connection speed
Close unnecessary browser tabs
Clear browser cache and cookies
Use a modern, updated browser
Check the Dashboard for system status
Contact support if issues persist across multiple users
tips: Large file uploads may temporarily slow the system
Complex queries may take longer to process
System performance is monitored on the Dashboard

faqs.question: Why are my file uploads failing?
faqs.answer: File upload issues can occur due to various factors. Follow these steps to resolve upload problems.
steps: Check file size - very large files may timeout
Verify file format is supported (PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, MD)
Ensure stable internet connection
Try uploading files one at a time
Check available storage space
Contact administrator if problems persist
limitations: Maximum file size limits may apply
Certain file types may be restricted

faqs.question: What should I do if data appears to be missing?
faqs.answer: If you notice missing information or data discrepancies, follow these diagnostic steps.
steps: Refresh the page to reload data
Check filters and search settings
Verify you have proper permissions for the data
Try logging out and back in
Contact Super Administrator if data loss is suspected
Check system logs if available

faqs.question: How should I organize content for best results?
faqs.answer: Proper content organization improves chatbot accuracy and system maintenance.
guidelines: Use clear, descriptive titles for text content
Keep file names descriptive and consistent
Regularly review and update outdated content
tips: Group related topics together
Use consistent terminology across content
Include context and examples in answers
Test content regularly with chatbot

faqs.question: How do I write effective answers to user questions?
faqs.answer: Quality answers improve user satisfaction and reduce repeat questions.
guidelines: Use simple language that users can understand
Include relevant examples or use cases
structure: Start with a direct answer to the question
End with additional resources if available

faqs.question: What regular maintenance should I perform?
faqs.answer: Regular maintenance keeps the system running smoothly and ensures data quality.
tasks: Review and answer pending questions regularly
Update department keywords based on user patterns
Clean up outdated or duplicate content
Update admin user accounts as needed
schedule: Daily: Check pending questions and system status
Weekly: Review upload content and answer quality
Monthly: Update department settings and clean data
Quarterly: Review user permissions and system usage
